isis.stitle: 10 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS SPICER AUTOMATE-2 - MAINTENANCE - FILTER REGULATOR (FIGURE 1)

svcproc.title: FILTER REGULATOR ( FIGURE 1)
svcproc.para: This unit uses a filter regulator preset at 50 to 55 lbs.

caution.para: Use only petroleum-based solvents to clean parts. Other types of solvents could damage filter compo nents and affect proper operation.
Blow air through the filter (inside and outside) to dislodge surface contaminants. Otherwise, these contaminants could affect proper filter operation and lead to equipment damage.
Do not disassemble the regulator section; it is not field- repairable. If it is damaged, replace it.

step1.para: Clean or replace the filter element every six to 12 months, or whenever slow shifting is encountered. The element should be replaced after three cleanings. If regulator malfunction is indicated, replace the entire unit.

To service the filter section, shut off the air pressure. Unscrew the bowl and remove the O-ring. Unscrew the stud. Remove louver, upper gasket, element, and lower gasket from the stud. Do not disassemble the regulator section.
After cleaning, inspect the parts carefully. Replace any damaged parts.

Reassemble the unit by first installing the filter element on the stud, so that the large end of the internal taper (thinnest wall section) is toward the hex on the stud. Tighten the stud to 5 to 10 in-lbs. (0.6 to 1.1 N· m).

Apply a wipe coat of Dow Corning DC7 Silicone Grease or the equivalent to the O-ring seating surfaces on the regulator and bowl. Apply a light, even coat of Molykote "G" or the equivalent to the bowl threads. Tighten the bowl to 5 to 10 in-lbs. (0.6 to 1.1 N· m). If the drain valve was removed, re-install it and tighten it to 10 to 15 in-lbs. (1.1 to 1.7 N·m).
